AIPyS.segmentation.parametric.GlobalSeg module

class AIPyS.segmentation.parametric.GlobalSeg.GlobalSeg(Image_name, outPath, block_size_cyto=11, offset_cyto=0.1, global_ther=0.1, clean=5, channel=2, bit8=255, ci=1)[source]

Bases: DataLoad

Initiate the Global segmentation :param Image_name: :type Image_name: (str) :param path: :type path: (str) :param block_size_cyto: Detect local edges 1-99 odd :type block_size_cyto: int :param offset_cyto: Detect local edges 0.001-0.9 odd :type offset_cyto: float :param global_ther: Percentile :type global_ther: float :param clean: opening operation, matrix size must be odd :type clean: int

Returns:

combine – global threshold binary map (eg cytoplasm)

Return type:

img

AIPyS.segmentation.parametric.ImageSeqGlobSeg module

class AIPyS.segmentation.parametric.ImageSeqGlobSeg.ImageSeqGlobSeg(videoName, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: GlobalSeg

Image sequences of segmented files are generated and saved as global segmented files, stored in the MP4 format. These are expected to be 8-bit images with the shape (w, h, c), where ‘c’ represents 3 channels.
